messages.title: YOUR SEAT COUNTS AND EVERY SINGLE VOTE WILL COUNT
messages.content: Some people say Jeremy Corbyn can’t possibly become Prime Minister and it doesn’t matter who you vote for in York Outer constituency. But don’t forget the opinion polls got the General Election wrong in 2015. They got the EU referendum wrong. And as Jeremy Corbyn has said himself, he was a 200-1 outside chance for the Labour leadership. Why risk it now with so much at stake?

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Making Brexit a success is central to our national interest – and it is central to your own security and prosperity. We need the best Brexit deal, and your economic security and prosperity will be at risk.

mentions.tacticalSituation: If Jeremy Corbyn wins in York Outer constituency, his position is strengthened and my bargaining position on Brexit is weakened. A vote for anyone but my candidate – Julian Sturdy – is still a vote for Jeremy Corbyn in your seat and all the 57 varieties of his coalition of chaos.

issues.brexitEurope: Making Brexit a success is central to our national interest – and it is central to your own security and prosperity. There is enormous opportunity for Britain as we leave the European Union. If we don't get Brexit right the consequences will be serious.
issues.economy: If we don't get the Brexit deal right, your economic security and prosperity will be at risk, and the opportunities you seek for your family will simply not happen.
issues.government: So the choice at this election is clear. Strong and stable leadership with me in the national interest to see us through Brexit and beyond, or a hung parliament and coalition of chaos with Jeremy Corbyn.

community.content: If you want to make a real difference, back me by voting for my candidate, Julian Sturdy, in your local constituency of York Outer. You will have a say in a strong and stable government, that will deliver the best Brexit deal for you and for Britain.

images.caption: Theresa May and Julian Sturdy – Strong and stable leadership for York Outer and for Britain
A Coalition of Chaos with Jeremy Corbyn – Labour plots Brexit deal with other parties if Tories don't win election majority

examples: They got the EU referendum wrong.
If we don't get the Brexit deal right, your economic security and prosperity will be at risk, and the opportunities you seek for your family will simply not happen.
Some people say Jeremy Corbyn can’t possibly become Prime Minister and it doesn’t matter who you vote for in York Outer constituency.
There is enormous opportunity for Britain as we leave the European Union.
Strong and stable leadership with me in the national interest to see us through Brexit and beyond.
A vote for anyone but my candidate – Julian Sturdy – is still a vote for Jeremy Corbyn in your seat and all the 57 varieties of his coalition of chaos.

Making Brexit a success is central to our national interest – and it is central to your own security and prosperity. We need the best Brexit deal, and your economic security and prosperity will be at risk.

So the choice at this election is clear. Strong and stable leadership with me in the national interest to see us through Brexit and beyond, or a hung parliament and coalition of chaos with Jeremy Corbyn.
Jeremy Corbyn negotiating Brexit – which we would all pay for in higher taxes, fewer jobs, more waste and more debt.
If Jeremy Corbyn wins in York Outer constituency, his position is strengthened and my bargaining position on Brexit is weakened.
